intro: Lepanthes boyacensis, commonly known as the Boyacá orchid, is a species of orchid native to Colombia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments within the cloud forests of the Andes. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with intricate patterns on the petals and sepals. Lepanthes boyacensis is valued for its ornamental beauty and plays a role in the biodiversity of its native habitat.
